choices: Tom decides to jump straight in.
Tom fetches some supplies and then jumps in.
Tom goes back to the house to tell his younger brother, Jack.
Tom goes to tell his parents.
Tom decides it would be best to leave it alone.
1.content:
It was a Friday afternoon and Tom was sat watching the TV with his parents and younger brother Jack, who was 10. Suddenly there was a loud bang and a flash of orange light flooded the room momentarily. Tom looked up startled yet nobody else seemed to have noticed. He left his seat and got up to go and investigate.

"Where are you going in such a hurry?" asked his mum. "It's your favourite programme!"

"Err, I need a drink." he replied, already in the kitchen.

"Ok, but hurry back or you'll miss it."

Tom opened the kitchen door and snuck outside onto the back garden to investigate the noise and light. In the far corner he could see what looked like a small glowing hole of some sort. He couldn't see anything on the other side as it looked like a cloth had been draped across it from the inside. Tom looked back at the house and then towards the hole again.
1.title: Lights, sound, action!

choices: ... the hole straight ahead of him.
... the new hole behind him.
... the hole to his left.
...the hole to his right.
...the hole three away to his right.
11.content:
Tom walked slowly toward the hole and drew the curtain to one side with his hand so that he could see inside. He put his head through the opening and peered inside.

On the other side of the drape it looked like a long white corridor that went on for eternity. Each side of the corridor was lined with many hundreds of holes with drapes. They were all the same colour and none were labeled in any way so that they all looked identical.

Tom let go of the curtain-like drape with his hand and was immediately pulled into the corridor. As soon as he was in, the holes on the walls began to spin around and rearrange themselves. Tom could only stare and try to follow where his exit was going. His attempts failed. He now had no idea of how to get out, back to his home and family. He stood staring as he tried to make a decision on which other hole to try. He eventually decides on...
11.title: Round and round they go!

choices: Go to the door and open it
Explore the dark void
111.content:
Tom jumped through the hole in front of him and into the area that he thought was a hallway, head first. He fell through the hole and crashed onto his head, passing out.
When he woke it was pitch black around him. He looked around and saw only one door at the end of the dark hallway and through the window of the door he saw some light seeping out. He looked up trying to find the way that he came into this hallway only to see that the hole that he took to get into this hallway was closed, leaving him trapped. When he looked left, right, and behind he saw only the dark and empty void staring back at him.
He was trapped in a sea of darkness with his only light coming from the window of a door.
111.title: Into Darkness

choices: Enter the Hole
Keep Running
Try to find somewhere else to hide.
1111.content:
Tom, like any rational person, walked towards the light instead of exploring the dark and terrifying endless abyss which surrounded him. Now that Tom was thinking about how terrifying the abyss was around him, he rushed over to the door and ripped it open.
On the other side he saw a world that was just a bunch of floating dots, some weird blue walls, and a pitch black floor that reminded Tom of the void he had just escaped from. Suddenly, loud noises start blaring and a sign reading "Ready Player One" appearred in the sky. In front of him, Tom saw a cheese wheel shape form and start eating the dots that were floating in place. Seeing imminent death via cheese wheel, Tom begins to run away from it. While running from the cheese wheel he finds a hole in the wall.
1111.title: Open the Door

choices: Tom stays and investigate "his" house.
Tom hears noises from the portal.
112.content: Tom decided he would try his luck with the new hole that had ended up behind him. He pulled the drape back and walked through into a garden. His garden! But something seemed different. After investigating his surroundings for a little while Tom realised that everything looked how it would if it was in a mirror, everything was reversed. In this world, left was right and right was left. Tom liked the idea of seeing his world in a different way. Maybe he would meet his mirrored self as well.
112.title: Mirror World

choices: Tom wants to find out who he is
Tom wants to meet his mirror family
1121.content:
Tom walked toward his house and saw his reflection as he passed by a window.
"YIKES!!!" he screamed with a high pitched voice.
Tom noticed that not only had right and left changed, he had changed as well. Tom was now a girl in this mirror world and his appearance looked definitely feminine. His features has softened out and, looking down, Tom noticed the beginnings of a pair of breasts!
As this was a new experience, Tom touched them to see if they were real. He then pinched himself and it hurt a lot which ruled out Tom being asleep.
He realized that he had become a girl.

Deciding to stick with this world for a while longer, Tom continued into the house.
1121.title: Further Investigations

choices: Meeting the mirror family
Meeting his mirror self
1122.content:
Tom turned around quickly and saw the portal disappear, folding in on itself. He was trapped in this mirror world!
Since left is right and right is left, did this mean that tom was opposite too? To make sure he walked up to the house and checked his reflection in one of the windows.
Thankfully his biggest fear had not been realised and he was still a boy although he did notice subtle changes like the fact that his hair was now parted in the opposite way and that his watch was on his opposite wrist.
So nothing seemed majorly different then.
He caught the sight of movement inside the house and decided to go and see who it was.
1122.title: Trapped in the mirror world!

choices: Something climbs out of the hole
It swallows him
Tom is shrinking!
113.content:
Being left handed, Tom decided to go for the first hole on the left. His body was quaking with exctiement. Nobody had ever heard of anything like this before, much less a 13 year old boy. He headed toward the glowing hole on the left excitedly. But when he had just about reached the hole it moved! It was very fast for a hole, quicker than Tom was. It moved away from him. Tom wasn't about to let it get away though. He chased after it. Every time he almost had it, it slipped away. One time it dissapeared right before his eyes, only to re-appear right behind him as he hit the floor from his diving attempt to reach it.

Eventually Tom got smart about it. He figured out that things weren't right in this corridor. Tom began to head the other way, away from the portal. He walked away for only ten minutes before the blue hole started chasing him. He led it in a circle and then jumped on it. He had one hand firmly in the hole, the other grasping at it's side. To his surprise the hole started getting bigger.
113.title: Chasing a Hole

choices: It Attacks Him
Tom Attacks It
It's Friendly
1131.content: As the hole gets bigger he sees a long, red disfigured arm with giant hands and claws attached reaching out of the hole towards him. Tom backs away from the hole just as he begins to see disgusting gooey, big, white eyes and big sharp teeth with a very long tongue come close to the opening behind the arms. It was almost as if he was being attacked by Carnage from Spider-Man
1131.title: Something climbs out of the hole

11311.content:
Tom screamed as he tried to run but too late, he felt the iron grip of the claws as they encircled his small waist. Try as he could, Tom could not escape and the pain was getting more intense as the grip tightened. He could hardly breathe. Tom's mind raced, how can he break free from this ferocious beast that was now growling in a most unearthly manner close to his head?

Before Tom's mind could begin to formulate a plan, it was already too late. As his life force left him, squeezed out by the raw power of the mysterious, beastly arm, it pulled him deep into the hole from which he would never return.
11311.title: It Attacks Him

choices: Tom has grown!
Tom has shrunk!
The sky is red!
1132.content:
The portal gains in size and after pulling back a little, then tosses Tom into the air and catches him like a cat swallowing a mouse in a cartoon. It feels to Tom as though he is in a giant water slide as he careers down the inside of the tube. The further he slides, the darker it becomes until he can no longer see his hand in front of his face! He continues on in darkness for several minutes more before light begins to rapidly return.

The light is bright and dazzling like looking at the Sun on a clear day which Tom soon realises it is. No longer is he hurtling down a dark tunnel. Instead he is laying on his back in the middle of a grassy field. Propping himself up on his elbows he looks around an notices that something isn't right.
1132.title: Tubes and Bright Lights

choices: An alien world
His house
His world but during another time
114.content: Tom decides on the hole to the right and jumps through. When he emerges from the other side he sees...
114.title: ...the hole to his right.

choices: He runs back to the hole
He runs to a friends house
other
1142.content:
He steps through and on the other side he sees his home. "Thank God," he says out loud and runs to the house. Just as he reaches the back door he notices something strange. It's his house, but something seems wrong. He shrugs and walks in. He then goes to re-join he family watching TV. He sits down and his Mom asks, "Tom, what are you doing back so soon? I thought you were going to Ami's house". Ami is his crush even though he's never told anyone.
"How did she find out?" Tom wonders. Then he hears a girlish giggle and looks over to see a young girl.
"Having girlfriend problems, Tommy?" she taunts.
"Who are you?" Tom blurts out.
"Tom, don't start fighting with your sister", his dad orders.
Tom's eyes go wide and he says, "I don't have a sister". He then looks around and asks, "Where's Jack"?
His Mom smiles and says, "Who's Jack? Now tell your sister you're sorry." Tom then looks around. There is no sign of Jack anywhere. All the family pictures have this girl standing in his place.
"This is all wrong," he mumbles and runs out of the house with his parents shouting after him.
1142.title: His house

choices: An armed woman in fatigues burst in, Tom is in danger
An alien shapeshifter burst in, Tom is really a prisoner in an alien universe
11421.content:
He ran back to the hole and was relieved that it was still there and glowing. This means it's still active, he thought. Tom quickly stepped in, hoping that the place he will end up will be his real home.

Tom found himself in bed and for a moment was a little disoriented. Was this all a dream? he wondered as he looked around his room. Everything looked fine and Tom's relief grew as he saw more familiar signs in his room. "I'll definitely not go into strange holes again". he whispered to himself. Stretching as though he just woke up, Tom got out of bed and walked to the bathroom. So far so good, the bathroom was where it has always been.

Tom turned on the tap and reached for the soap, where it has always been. Lathering his hands, and with the tap still running Tom began to wash his face, ...and froze. His soapy hands felt the unfamiliar beard on his chin! "What the hell?!", he yelped as his eyes focused on the image in the mirror. The face looking back at Tom was that of a grown man with a full beard, and aged around thirty.

"Holy crap!, I've changed!", Tom exclaimed, his stomach feeling suddenly uneasy. Before he could think of how he could have reached this state, he was startled by a voice outside the bathroom door.

"Are you in here?"

Tom did not recognize the female voice and hesitated before replying, "Yes,...Just a minute..." His deep voice startled him.

"Be a good boy and open the door!", the voice said soothingly.

Tom dried his face, as thoughts flooded his mind. Is this my wife or girlfriend? he wondered. He slowly opened the door, hoping that the woman he would see would at least be attractive.

The door was thrown open by the female and Tom screamed.
11421.title: He runs back to the hole

choices: Tom broke free and dashed to the guarded hole, escape!
Tom's attempt failed, he was thrown into the larger portal.  Fears!
114212.content:
"There you are. You have been a bad boy and must be punished!", the female creature hissed as Tom stepped back from her in fear. For a brief instant the female's true alien form was shown before she assumed the form of an attractive and seductive woman. Despite Tom's terror, he was inexplicably drawn to the woman's exotic beauty.

"Come here my darling", the woman / creature cooed and Tom felt himself walking toward her. She took his hand and led him out of the bathroom toward the living room. Tom realized two things immediately. The woman's touch was cold! He gasped as he also realized that what he thought was his familiar bedroom was nothing but an illusion created by the aliens for his benefit. Now as he was being led toward the living room, the bathroom and his bedroom disintegrated and were replaced with plain gray space with nothing else to distinguish it.

Tom whimpered as he felt drawn by some powerful force that was impelling him toward an inexplicable obedience to this alien being. He was also deeply scared about what he would encounter next. Tom desperately wished for another hole.

"No, no....", Tom whimpered as he was finally led into the "living room" where other beings were assembled. Just as happened before, Tom was able to briefly see the true alien forms before they all transformed into different versions of beautiful and exotic females.

"What punishment shall we inflict for this latest attempt to escape us?", the creature that had found him in the bathroom hissed. A strikingly attractive creature, presumably the leader, hissed "We shall confine it to the portal of terror".

Tom shuddered as he grappled with what unspeakable torture this "portal of terror" would be. Before he could do anything, he was held by other cold hands and dragged toward the front door and placed in a strange glowing vehicle. After what seemed like seconds, Tom felt the vehicle stop and his captors pulled him outside where he found a portal being guarded by two aliens in their true forms. Tom noticed that neither alien bothered to hide their repulsive appearance. In fact, once outside the vehicle, all the creatures assumed their true forms.

"You are being punished for your latest attempt to escape. For this you will be sent for seven earth days to the portal of terror where you will meet the thing that you fear most. Very few creatures survive beyond the first day.", the lead creature hissed, with unearthly laughter.

Tom trembled and he felt his knees go suddenly weak and it took great effort for him to remain upright. He looked around and saw for the first time that the green skies and black clouds were nothing like what he would have seen on earth. The ground was also a strange spongy gray material. Tom also noticed that beside the guarded portal was another portal that was much larger. It was to that portal that he was being led. Tom suddenly thought that the portal he was being taken was the punishing "portal of terror", but what of the portal being guarded, could this be his way out?

It was at that moment that Tom decided to make a desperate break from his captors.
114212.title: An alien shapeshifter burst in!

choices: Deja vu with a twist
Tom does something different
1142121.content:
Tom broke free and dashed desperately to the hole being guarded by the two aliens. The startled creatures did not have time to react as Tom dove between the guards into the glowing hole.

Tom found himself in bed and for a moment was a little disoriented. Was this all a dream? he wondered as he looked around his room. Everything looked fine and Tom's relief grew as he saw more familiar signs in his room. "I'll definitely not go into strange holes again". he whispered to himself. Stretching as though he just woke up, Tom got out of bed and walked to the bathroom. So far so good, the bathroom was where it has always been. "Didn't I do this already?", Tom thought as he suddenly realized this Deja vu.

Tom turned on the tap and reached for the soap, where it has always been. Lathering his hands, and with the tap still running Tom began to wash his face, ...and froze. His soapy hands felt the unfamiliar beard on his chin! "What the hell?!", he yelped as his eyes focused on the image in the mirror. The face looking back at Tom was that of a grown man with a full beard, and aged around thirty.

"Holy crap!, I've changed!", Tom exclaimed, his stomach feeling suddenly uneasy. Before he could think of how he could have reached this state, he was startled by a voice outside the bathroom door.

"Are you in here?"

Tom did not recognize the female voice and hesitated before replying, "Yes,...Just a minute..." His deep voice startled him.

"Be a good boy and open the door!", the voice said soothingly.

Tom dried his face, as he thought again that this series of events was vaguely familiar. Is this my wife or girlfriend? he wondered. He slowly opened the door, hoping that the woman he would see would at least be attractive.

The door was thrown open by the female and Tom screamed.

"There you are. You have been a bad boy and must be punished!", the female creature hissed as Tom stepped back from her in fear.
1142121.title: Tom broke free and dashed to the guarded hole, ...

choices: Back to his original reality
Another, strange reality
11421211.content:
For a brief instant the female's true alien form was shown before she assumed the form of an attractive and seductive woman. Despite Tom's terror, he was inexplicably drawn to the woman's exotic beauty.

"Come here my darling", the woman / creature cooed and Tom felt himself walking toward her. Tom however recognized that he had gone through this already and he resolved to change this. She took his hand and led him out of the bathroom toward the living room. Tom realized two things immediately. The woman's touch was cold! He gasped as he also realized that what he thought was his familiar bedroom was nothing but an illusion created by the aliens for his benefit. Now as he was being led toward the living room, the bathroom and his bedroom disintegrated and were replaced with plain gray space with nothing else to distinguish it.

Tom whispered "this is not real. This is not real". As he did so, the hypnotic hold of the alien creature on him was broken and Tom saw the creature's true form, every slimy, slithering detail. Tom desperately wished for another hole.

"This is not real. This is not real", Tom repeated aloud and all the creatures assembled in the "living room" began to flicker, as though they were intangible light. As the surroundings transformed, Tom realized with surprise that he was still in a portal and had never actually emerged since he ran away from the alternative "family" toward a hole.

Tom felt the pull of the portal and the sensation of falling. He was still a little confused and anxious, not knowing where and how he will end up.
11421211.title: Deja vu with a twist

choices: Fun times.
Problems!
11422.content:
Tom doesn't like the idea of having a younger sister and thinks that he should leave this place as fast as possible because now his beloved younger brother Jack was replaced by a girl. Or maybe this is another reality where Jack had been born as a girl…?
Anyhow, Tom had no real intention of finding out more about this because it didn't feel right.
But what about Ami? Maybe she would be different here and she would be his girlfriend instead of a secret crush.
This was the only reason holding him back from returning to the hole in order to search for his correct reality.
Curiosity getting th better of him, he decided to go over to Ami's house.
11422.title: He runs to a friends house

choices: Is it Tom's room???
More series of doors, but they are different.
New empty room.
115.content: He walks right on over to the holes but passes them on by, one...two...thr- no, the third one was different from the rest, it was calling him, it glowed brightly and he felt attraction. His mind told him to go and like he had no choice he walked forward, one step at a time and he had no choice but to enter inside.
115.title: ...the hole three away to his right.

choices: The Princess wakes Tom.
A doctor wakes Tom.
Tom awakes, no longer in the medical room.
1153.content:
The light fades and his whole body is once again in control, he sees it is a dark room not because of the room itself but because there was nothing around giving any light, although it looked white and goldish so it would probably reflect light very well. He stares around in awe before placing eyesight on the big doors in front of him, he runs to them because they were perhaps his only way out but he trips, feeling exhausted, and tumbles down five of the steps that led from the place he appeared, almost like a ritual looking place.
Tom feels a pain spread across his face and lets out a slight laugh at himself because of how ridiculous the situation is, he needed to recieve help. He felt exhausted like he had been running a marathon so stopped to gather his senses.
The doors ahead of him opened quickly, slamming as they did, making him realize the doors were much lighter than they looked. Standing there is some twelve or thirteen year old girl draped in such old looking clothes. Even if they look newly made they seemed like the Medieval kind, some kind of robe perhaps, it looked fancy though so she may be very wealthy. She seemed panicked so Tom got up on my left knee and raised his head to listen to her.
"It can't be, how can a hero summon himself, how do I explain this? How strong is he, can he understand my language? Is this a premonition, is it good? Bad? Is he a hero?" Tom just stared in silence with a blank face thinking things may take awhile.
Tom looks at her and interrupts. "Just to clear it up, I am not from here. I saw some glowy thingy, a hole by the looks, back in my own world. I touched it and it pulled me somewhere with more hole-looking things. I got drawn to a glowing bright one and it brought me here, I tried heading to those doors but I feel a huge amount of exhaustion, like I ran a marathon!!!"
She gasps and starts doing calculations with her fingers. "It seems you were victimized by your own magic, your power was activated to send you here once the conditions were unlocked, I don't think you will ever realize the conditions but you summoned yourself here it seems and hero's only come in time of need. Currently it is peaceful here so either you aren't a hero but instead you are the majesty's guest. By the way, I am his daughter so it would be nice to welcome you. The second possibility is that you came here by fate and something will happen or is happening that needs to be stopped that we are yet unaware of. We will get you patched up right away and I can sense a lot of strength from you. I don't think I have heard much about self-summoning magic, it wasn't portal or teleport magic from what you described but it isn't anything the kingdom would know about. Maybe you can ask a great sage if you manage to find one." She declares politely while moving her hand over Tom's body. It was kind of like some sort of analysis or diagnostic, it seemed. Tom wished she would stop because being examined seems kind of like an invasion of personal space that he wasn't ready for. She helps him up with a hand and he walks with her through the door and down the halls. She brings him to a medical room where he lies down and waits for treatment.
Tom looks around bored of what can and can't be done and thinks of many things he wants to do but can't. Suddenly a games console appears in front of him just as he was thinking of one but it disappears as his mind goes blurry and he passes out.
1153.title: New chapter for a boy of 13

choices: something takes it from him.
something grabs him and pulls him in.
he feels something moves in his hand.
12.content:
Tom runs back inside to the kitchen and begins to go through the cupboards. He grabs a bag of Oreos, a cherry Dr. Pepper and a flashlight before rushing back outside. In his excitement he decides not to alert his parents to his 'little' excursion. He takes an Oreo and sticks his hand into the mysterious hole.

Suddenly:
12.title: Oreos

choices: Tom is caught by the armed men...
Tom successfully hides as they raid the building trying to find him.
Tom successfully gets out of the building unseen...
121.content:
All of a sudden, the oreo seems to be swiped from his hand. Tom retracted his hand from the hole and discovered that the Oreo had indeed been taken.

The hole grew brighter now, as if affected by the Oreo going through it. Suddenly it enlarged, engulfed Tom and then dissappeared.

-----

Tom landed on a hard, concrete surface in a poorly lit room with no windows and a doorway with no door. He rubbed his bottom and found the Oreo he had taken before lying on the ground, untouched.
"Where am I?" He murmured. Standing up, he walked out through the doorway and discovered that he appeared to be in some sort of long abandoned building. Approaching the edge of the building, he looked out a large broken window and discovered that he was in a completely different place. A violent thunderstorm was brewing in the distance and the surrounding area was full of multi-storey buildings that also looked abandoned.

He also appeared to be about ten floors up. Looking down, he discovered that a vehicle had quickly pulled up and screeched to a halt. Armed men in strange uniforms jumped out and began running into the building.

"That can't be good" He said, leaving the window and trying to find a place to hide.
121.title: The oreo taken...

choices: "No, he's of no value. Get rid of him"
"Keep him, he might be worth something to a slave dealer"
"Throw him out in the gutter..."
1211.content:
Tom looked around for a good hiding spot, all the while hearing several footsteps on the stairs getting closer and closer. They were obviously making no attempt to conceal their existence.

As large as the building was, it was completely empty aside from the vastness of concrete. Tom attempted to cower behind a wall as they appeared but was soon found and hit in the back of the head, making everything in his view spin.
"Got something!" Came a muffled distorted sounding voice.
"Mhm?" Asked another.
"He looks alive... Just some stupid kid"
"Anything else come through the portal?"
"Just a biscuit" Someone else said. The biscuit was dropped in front of Tom's head on the flood and crushed under a heavy boot.
"He's got some more biscuits here... And a torch and a can of drink... Do we keep him?" The first man said. Tom was still woozy and couldnt move.
1211.title: Tom is caught by the armed men...

choices: "That way" Kazumi said, pointing to the building across the road...
"Down to the streets" Kazumi said...
12111.content:
"No, he's of no value. Get rid of him" One man said, who appeared to be calling the shots.
"Roger that" Said one man, aiming his weapon at Toms head.
"Might want to keep that torch... It'll be useful later" The commanding man said.

Tom finally managed to look up at the person aiming at him. He wore a black trenchcoat and a gasmask. Tom was no expert, but the weapon looked like some sort of sub-machinegun, like a P90 from the game Counter-Strike that he had been recently playing.

The man seemed to notice that he had regained consciousness and adjusted his aim slightly.

All of a sudden, there was a crash in the distance. Everyone was distracted by the noise and then a burst of gunfire was heard, followed by a cracking sound and a thud as someone hit the floor hard. Then more gun fire and men yelling:
"It's her! Quick, open fire!"
"She's here!"
"Get her!"

The various rooms surrounding Tom were suddenly filled with the sound of gunfire, each one eventually going quiet. Tom was still lying on the floor, now very fearful for his life. Then, a different boot came into view, this one a black sneaker.
"Damn... such a waste." The owner of the sneaker said - a female, british.
"You alive?" She said, bending down to look at him and poking his face.
"Ow"
"Then get up. We need to get out of here because an alert would have been sent out"
"What happened?" Tom asked, sitting up against a wall.
"You came through a portal, right? I'll explain everything later, but we really NEED to go - now"
"Do I even get to know your name?" Tom asked.
"Kazumi. And yours?" Kazumi asked.

"Tom"
"Well then, Tom, let's go" Kazumi said, lifting Tom up. He could finally see her face now. She was definately british, with jet black hair, slightly pale skin and emerald eyes.
"Stop staring" She said, looking right at Tom.
"Right, sorry... Where are we going?"
12111.title: "No, he's of no value. Get rid of him"

choices: Kazumi opens a secret door...
Kazumi takes Tom back into some different buildings...
121111.content:
"That way" Kazumi said, pointing to the building across the road.

Tom looked across to the building on the other side of the road. It looked just as abandoned and perfectly accessable... from the streets.
"So, down to the streets?" Tom asked.
"No, literally, just straight across to there" Kazumi said. Tom looked at her confused.
"Oh, right, you don't know" She said. "Welcome to the Metaworld... The physics of everything is different here. VERY different. You just gotta trust me, okay? I'll jump first"

Kazumi sauntered to the far wall, prepared herself and then ran towards the edge of the building. Just as she hit the edge, she jumped and sailed right across the gap and landed cleanly on the other side.

"Now you do it!" She yelled back to Tom.

Tom didn't know if this was a dream or a nightmare. A strange British girl called Kazumi just told him to jump to another building. Figuring it was better than being here, He tried the same thing that she did. Tom was shocked at seeing himself several hundred meters above the ground, hurtling towards another building.
Suddenly, the other building was right on him, and he came crashing down onto the floor.
"Well, first times a charm" Kazumi said, picking him up. Fortunately, that's the only jump for a while.
"What was that?" Tom asked.
"I just said; the physics in this world is vastly different to Earth... You'll get used to it" She said. "Come on"

Kazumi led Tom through a myriad of abandoned rooms and halls, down a few flights of stairs and then up one.
"All this used to be populated, one mans dream of a world away from the frights of Earth. Well, that's what people say anyway" Kazumi said, leading Tom. "Except it backfired. He wanted to open it up to people to come and live in a world of peace, and so a few people thought they could rule the place with guns. The machine holding this world together got broken and hey, look at it now"
"So this place is virtual?" Tom asked.
"No, not as far as anyone can work out. More that it's in another dimension of sorts. But because the machine was broken, random portals on earth open up, suck a few things through and then dump it here. A few rare times people come through, sometimes it's a few useful tools and the like, but mostly it's junk"
"Sounds terrible"
"My name is Kazumi, I am nineteen years old and I have lived in this world for two years, three months and sixteen days"
"What?" Tom asked in surprise.
"I tell myself that everyday, as proof of two things. That I am alive and I havent gone insane... yet"
"Yea, about that" Tom said. "Arent you British? Whats with a name like Kazumi?"
Kazumi laughed a little. "It was my player name in an online game a long time ago. I felt it fitted better here in this world than my Earth name"

The myriad of halls and abandoned rooms eventually opened up to a plaza. Kazumi walked along a covered walkway, taking care to not go in the light. A flying vehicle suddenly passed overhead, making a sound similar to a plane. It passed harmlessly overhead, heading towards where Tom had appeared in this world.
121111.title: "That way" Kazumi said

choices: Kazumi keeps explaining about the world...
Kazumi and Tom are interrupted by a knock on the door...
1211111.content:
Kazumi knocked three times on a green metal door. A small panel opened on it to show a set of eyes. It quickly slammed shut again and then the door unlocked.

Kazumi hauled the heavy door open and pulled Tom inside.
The man who had opened the door for them wore a large jacket with a scarf around his mouth. He was holding a rifle in his hands. As soon as Tom and Kazumi were inside, he closed it again, saying nothing.
"Thanks" Tom said. "Who are yo-"

Kazumi had quickly put her hand over his mouth, staring flatly at him and shaking her head slowly.
"You don't talk to a savant" She said. "Something else I'll explain later. In fact, it's probably for the best that you don't say anything at all right now and keep your stuff hidden."
Kazumi led Tom down a long flight of stairs and opened another door. They walked through onto a catwalk above a huge - massive open storage shed. While it once might have been used for a shed, it was now a shanty town, filled with people in poor quality clothing milling around doing what they could to survive. A few looked up at Tom and Kazumi but couldnt care less about the newcomer. Kazumi led Tom down the catwalk into the 'streets'. After a few minutes walking, they came to a railway track and headed into a tunnel.
"Used to be a service depot for a subway" Kazumi said. "Now we call it New Haven. One of the last few villages in this wasteland that the Overlords havent yet discovered. I'll take you to my place."

The subway tunnel was poorly lit by an array of lamps that were jammed into the ceiling. There were an innunermerable number of houses occupying two thirds of the tunnel, while the last third was for public access, but really was only large enough for one person to walk at a time.

Five minutes later, Kazumi welcomed Tom into her home, a ramshackle hut with a half broken wooden door on the front. This also appeared to be right on the edge of town, as only two houses further down, the tunnel was blocked by a massive pile of metal and rubbish.
Kazumi's house was suprisingly well furnished, and it looked like she had somehow dug out a part of the tunnel wall to massively increase the size of her residence.
"Welcome home" She said, smiling slightly and flopping down onto an old wooden chair. There was a potbelly stove in the corner, a torn rug on the ground and a fair sized table against one wall with some paper and a few pens on it.
Tom sat down on another chair which looked a little sturdier.
"So, could you please explain everything for me?" He asked, extremely confused about everything.

"I think I'll start at the beginning. You've just been pulled into this place we call the Metaworld. The physics are different here, as you found out. If you've got batteries in that torch, for some reason they'll never burn out - ever. There's a few other differences as well, but the need for food and water hasnt changed, making anything consumable highly valued."
"So thats why you told me to hide my stuff"
"Exactly. I can give you all the food and water you want, but I should inform you that the fizzy drink and biscuits you have are valued far more uneaten than they are consumed. If you want, I can find you a good buyer"
"Uhh... Thanks... I guess" Tom said.
"Anyway, about that Savant guy. You heard the men in the building, how they sounded werid?"
"Yea?" Tom asked.
"That's because they undergo surgery to modify their bodys, which includes a vocalizer that changes the way they speak. Before the memory implantation, there's a small window where we can rescue them. We call them savants... "lucky saved". They guard our borders with their lives, but without the memory implantation, they have no idea how to work the vocalizers aside from making a few grunts and squeals... A small price for freedom"
1211111.title: Kazumi opens a secret door...

12111112.content:
"Alright, so now what?" Tom asked.
"Eh?" Kazumi asked.
"How do I get back?" Tom asked. "I can't exactly stay here forever"
Kazumi stared blankly at him.

"You can't go back. Ever. Nobody can. When you appear here, you're stuck here forever," she said flatly. Tom stared at her.

Kazumi shook her head and looked down. "I'll help get you set up with a place to live. Considering how little we have here, I doubt it will be much."

Tom sat there, dumbfounded, very slowly accepting the idea that he wouldn't be able to return. Kazumi looked up at him and was about to say something but was interrupted by a knock on her door.
"Hold up," she said, opening the door slightly.

A dark clothed man in a trenchcoat stood there and murmured something to her. Kazumi nodded and closed the door.
"I've got to go for a minute. You can stay here and eat something... I'll be back shortly," she said, picking up a pistol, holstering it on her belt and then leaving.

132.content:
"Isn't it cool?" Tom asked his younger brother, showing off the glowing portal he had found. "Now, come on. I want to see what's on the other side." He grabbed Jack's arm and began dragging him towards the hole.

"Wait!" Jack protested, freeing his arm from Tom's grip. "Wait a minute. I'm scared! We don't even know what's on the other side."

"But that's part of the fun, isn't it?" Tom replied, grinning down at his brother.

"Wouldn't you like to watch TV instead?"

Tom sighed in frustration. "Oh, don't worry. Everything will be fine." He grabbed his brother's arm once more and stopped in front of the vortex. "After you," he said to Jack rather politely, before simply picking him up and tossing him into the vortex. He heard Jack's screams echo as he travelled through the hole.

Tom smiled, anticipating what he would find on the other side. He looked back once more at his house. He could hear his parents laughing at the program on TV. Without hesitation, he jumped into the portal, bidding farewell to this boring life.

*************************************************

A few moments later, he landed on the ground a few feet from Jack. Both brothers stood up, looking around.

"Where are we?" Jack asked, a little scared.

"I don't know," Tom replied. "But we're about to find out. Come on." He took his brother's hand and started walking, wondering what kind of a place this was, himself. Right now, they appeared to be in a forest of some kind, but a little ways in front of them, Tom could see a group of houses, every light in the area turned on. The people living there were having a celebration of some kind. Both boys could hear music and cheering up ahead.

"I don't like this," Jack said, with fear in his voice.

"Oh, will you just relax," Tom said, getting fed up with his brother's cowardice. "Everything will be fine. I promise."

Tom and Jack made it to a roadway and observed the various people walking down the street.

"Where are we, Tom?" Jack asked.

"I don't know," Tom replied, regretting going through the portal in his backyard a little, upon seeing the inhabitants that lived on the other side. "I just don't know."

“The beach,” you said slowly. “Yes. Yeah, we were going to go to the beach, weren't we?”

You knew full well that in your original version of reality, you'd had no such plans for today. Apparently there were more differences than mere gender flip-flopping that separated this strange new realm from the comfortable world you knew and loved.

“C'mon, Tammy!” pressed the girl. “Are we like going to the beach today or not? Girl, you are all spacey and stuff today. What's with you?”

“I'm not feeling like myself,” you admitted. “But yeah, let's go to the beach.”

You started for the garden gate.

“Excuse me?” laughed the girl. “Aren't you forgetting something Tammy?”

“Hmm, what?” you asked in surprise.

“You're not going to the beach dressed like that, are you?” the girl laughed.

“Oh, uh, no of course not,” you muttered.

You and the strange girl headed inside, presumably so you could pick out a good bikini to wear to the beach!

Passing through the kitchen, your mum confirmed your suspicions as to the identity of this strange girl when she said, “Oh, hello Michelle. Tell your parents we had a lovely time meeting them for dinner last weekend. We should all get together and do that again sometime.”

“Thanks! I'll let them know,” answered Michelle.

So Michelle is analogous to Mike in this world, you think. Your folks had met Mike's parents for dinner last weekend and Michelle bears more than a coincidental passing resemblance to your mate Mike. She could easily be his sister.

Very interesting.

But you still have little interest in spending the rest of your days trapped on Earth-TG or whatever this odd little alternate reality was. Somehow, you've got to find that hole again … or at least another one just like it.

“Holes in the ground?” laughs Michelle. “What – are you crazy, Tammy?”

You sigh glumly, prepared to resign yourself to this new fate of being a cute teenage girl: today dressed in a bikini and cavorting about on the beach!

“Of course I've seen them,” continued Michelle. “I was the one who told you about them in the first place. Nobody else would believe me about seeing that weird hole in my backyard. And then the one in the park just the other day. I thought you said you believed me, Tammy? You're not teasing me now, are you?”

You vehemently shake your head no.

“I'm not teasing you Michelle. I promise,” you reply. “I just … I guess I forgot that you'd seen them.”

She looks at you skeptically.

“Tammy, what's going on?” she finally asks. “Tell me the truth: we've been friends since we were little girls together, playing dollhouse and tea party. Why are you suddenly interested in those eerie holes I was seeing around town the past couple days?”

“I saw one myself,” you admit quietly.

“I knew it!” Michelle exclaims. “See – I'm not crazy! People don't believe me, just because they think I'm a dumb teenage girl. They think I'm a stupid, brain dead bimbo or something! It's totally unfair. And see, I wasn't making it up, was I? It was a freaky, glowing hole to nowhere, right?”

“No,” you correct her. “It most definitely leads somewhere.”

“You've been inside one?” gasps Michelle.

You nod your head in the affirmative.

“What's inside?” she asks quietly.

"I'll help you Tammy," says Michelle. "But no more making fun of me."

'I swear, Michelle, I am not making up any of this,' Tom insists. 'And I wouldn't make fun of you. In the world that I remember, you and I are best pals.'

Being a girl has been an interesting experience, but Tom still finds himself quite eager to return to the ordinary version of reality where he had a y-chromosome and no breasts.

'All right then,' says Michelle. 'Follow me, and I'll show you the last place I saw one of these creepy holes.'

Michelle leadsTom away from the beach, up a small hill, and into an empty meadow full of weeds.

'I don't see anything,' Tom says.

'It was here earlier in the day,' Michelle insists. 'Look, I don't know where it went to now. You said yourself, Tammy, that the hole you saw vanished later. These weird things just pop up and then disappear!'

Tom frowns in concentration as he squints and gazes out across the meadow of thick weeds. There's an unusual rippling shimmer amongst the tall grass about midway through the field. He starts walking out into the thick of the meadow.

'Tammy? Hey, Tammy! Where do you think you're going?' Michelle cries, warily following along behind him. 'Ewww, why are you stomping through these nasty weeds?'

'I see something out here,' he insists.

Indeed, as Tom gets closer and closer to the shimmering ripple, he discovers another hole in reality ' perhaps a bit larger than the one he explored earlier.

Michelle backs away nervously, clearly frightened of the thing.

'Don't touch it, Tammy,' she warns.

'I've already poked my head through one already today,' he tells her.

'Yeah, and look what it did to you,' she says. 'It made you think you used to be a man. Yuck! Tammy, there's no telling what it'll do to you next. That thing is evil. It's going to drive you insane.'

'No, I don't think so,' Tom replies. 'I think it's my ticket back to my own body and my own version of reality.'

And with that, he climbs in.

1512111111112.content:
"Actually, the one I saw was at the edge of town, about fifteen minutes away if we take our bikes," Michelle smiled. Tammy was relieved to hear that another hole existed but was disappointed that it was not nearby.

"OK, let's get the bikes and go. I want to get out of here quickly," Tammy said, getting up.

"We could catch a bus instead and reach it quicker. That's better than going back home first for the bikes," Michelle replied.

"OK then, let's do that," Tammy said.

Both girls walked to the bus stop and within five minutes were on a bus heading to the edge of town. During the short ride, Tammy was looking out the window to see what else had changed and noticed that a number of familiar landmarks were not the same. The most glaring difference was that the famous McDonald's arches that were always in the Mid-Town Mall were absent. In it's place was a giant "W".

"Er, Michelle, what's with the giant "W"?" Tammy asked.

"You're really from out of space. That's the famous Wanda's franchise," Michelle laughed.

"Huh? Not McDonald's?" Tammy practically choked.

"Who's McDonald's?" Michelle asked puzzled.

"Oh, never mind," Tammy sighed.

The bus pulled to a stop and both girls got off.

"Where to?" Tammy asked.

"This way!" Michelle said excitedly, as she led Tammy toward a wooded area not far from the bus terminal.

"I knew a hole was here somewhere," Michelle muttered as she searched earnestly for the missing hole. Tammy was growing more anxious by the minute as she watched her friend moving first this way and then that, to no avail.

After what seemed like an eternity, but was in fact only ten minutes, Michelle sighed in exasperation, "It's not here!"

Tammy's disappointment was clearly etched on her face and Michelle tried to make light of the situation.

"It's not so bad after all Tam, just think of this as a temporary setback. another hole will appear. They usually do," Michelle said.

"OK, lets go home then..." Tammy sighed.

Both girls walked back to the bus stop to catch another bus home. Tammy was deep in thought as she realized that she might be trapped here without any hope of returning to the familiar world of Tom.

The shimmering in the weeds turned out to be a hole and you were relieved. "It's a hole Michelle!"

"Wait!" Michelle called after you, "... Suppose it doesn't take you back to where you belong?" she asked.

"Michelle, I wish I could stay, but I have to go now!" you yelled as you dashed toward the fading hole.

151211112.content:
"No..... Are you sure you're alright?", Michelle replied. "You are certainly not acting yourself today, what's the matter?" , she asked. You were becoming desperate as you realized that your "friend" did not know what you were talking about.

"Are you sure you have not seen anything strange around here, a hole that glows?", you asked, your voice becoming a little shaky. Michelle shook her head and looking at you with concern, again asked, "You alright?"

"No! I'm not alright! I need to get back home!", you exclaimed.

Michelle was puzzled, "But we just got here, why do you want to go home now?"

"I just need to get back home, I don't feel so well, can we just go?!", you snapped.

"OK then, its no point staying here with you like this", she conceded.

Later at your "home" you immediately went to the backyard garden to see if another hole had appeared. To your relief you saw one by the tool shed.

"Alright! I can really go home now!", you exclaimed. Michelle stood in awe as she looked at the strange glowing hole by the shed. "W-what is that?", she whispered.

"That's my ticket out of here!", you said gleefully as you ran to it. "Stop! What do you think you are doing?!", Michelle shouted.

You did not pay attention and without looking back at your "friend", you jumped through the hole.
151211112.title: No- she thinks you're acting mad today

1512111121.content:
You fell to the ground with a grunt and it took a while to tune in to the sights and sounds around you.

"Gruuurmmmmpppt!"

You did not immediately realize that you were the target of that word sound and before you could focus, you felt a sharp pain in your chest, followed by an explosion. Three more explosions followed and each bullet (you thought) tore through your flesh.

You lay on the ground and through dying eyes saw the shape of a hulking figure standing over you, with a huge blade in its right hand, a high caliber weapon in its left. The visage that appeared before you with its wide triumphant showing of sharp, alien teeth sent your brain in a gibberish as all sense abandoned you.

You would have screamed, if you could.
1512111121.title: An abrupt end to your travels

151212.content:
Your eyes widen in shock at the sight of the man looking up at you. At least, you think it's a man. He's about two feet tall, has one eye, two noses, and a bright blond soul patch underneath his chapped lips. The man snapped his suspended straps, and starts to talk in a peppy southern accent. He jumps up to look you in the eyes. "Well howdy there! My name is Alistair Holemepper! Who might you be?"

All you can do is blink, unable to process the strange sight before you. You shake your head to see if the man disappears, to no avail. "My name is-" you say, still unused to your new voice. You cough, and try to deepen your voice. "My name is Tommy."

The short man snaps his fingers and does a strange little jig. "We'll hoo-boy, Tommy sure is an ugly name for such a pretty girl, don't you think?"

You frown, and try to fold your arms. Still unused to your new breasts however, your hands fumble, and you let them fall to your sides. "Look, Al, I don't-"

"Alistair Holemepper, please! Don't make me say it again," he laughs cheerily, bouncing up to meet your height.

You pinch the bridge of your nose. "Yes, okay, Alistair Holemepper." You bend down on one knee, partly to meet him face to face, and partly so he'll stop jumping. "Because you're about as strange as everything I've seen in my-" You pause, unsure of what you just said. "Everything I've seen in Tammy's house," you emphasize, "I'm going to ask if you have anything to do with these holes."

Alistair continued bouncing up and down, giggling as he did. "Well of course I do! My name is Alistair-"

"Alistair Holemepper, yes!" you shout. "We all know that your name is Alistair Holemepper!"

"That's my name, don't wear it out!"

If this man didn't have something to do with these strange holes, you swear you'd strangle him. "Look," you say, trying to control your temper, "if you know about these holes, then can you help me get back to my own world? You know, where I don't have-" You gesture at your breasts, still uncomfortable with acknowledging them directly.

The short man once again laughs his grating laugh, and taps you on the nose. He opened his mouth, and got ready to speak.
151212.title: A mysterious short, small, strange-looking being.

Running from your room back to the garden is a strange sensation. Your center of gravity has changed: you've got a narrower waist, wider hips and behind, and jiggling new weights bouncing up and down on your chest as you run.

“This is too weird,” you mutter to yourself as you dash out the door.

“Tammy, where you going in such a hurry?” asks your mum as you slam the door behind you.

No time to explain, you think. There's no telling how long that hole in the garden will remain there. It appeared out of nowhere, after all. It could theoretically disappear at any time.

You run back to the far corner of the garden and breathe a sigh of relief. It's still there!

“Goodbye Tammy!” you say to yourself, leaping into the hole.

What happens when you emerge?

info.brief_description: One day Tom finds a strange glowing hole in his back garden.
info.description:
Basic story line; Tom, a 13 year old boy, finds a glowing portal in his back garden one day and steps through. You decide what happens to Tom on the other side and what the place looks like.

Please remember this is a 13+ story - I would like it to keep this rating please.

Any exceptionally short chapters, less than three sentences, may be subject to editing or removal.
Chapters that I also feel do not fit the story or the age rating may also be subject to removal at my discretion.
